keyMoments.title: Garp's First Appearance
keyMoments.description: Vice Admiral Monkey D. Garp makes his debut, arriving to take custody of Morgan. He briefly falls asleep during the handover and shouts back when reprimanded.
keyMoments.significance: First introduction of one of the most important characters in One Piece - a Marine legend who will later be revealed as Luffy's grandfather.

keyMoments.title: Garp Recruits Koby and Helmeppo
keyMoments.description: After Morgan's escape, Garp decides to take Koby and Helmeppo to Marine Headquarters for training instead of dismissing them.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Garp as a mentor figure and sets Koby and Helmeppo on their path to becoming strong Marines.
keyMoments.quote: I have no choice but to tell you to come with me to Marine Headquarters. If you don't like it, you can run away.

relationships.description: Garp recruits Koby to train at Marine Headquarters, beginning their mentor-student relationship.

evolutionMoments.description: Garp decides to train Koby at Marine Headquarters after seeing his potential during Morgan's escape.

relationships.description: Garp recruits Helmeppo to train at Marine Headquarters alongside Koby.

evolutionMoments.description: Garp decides to train Helmeppo at Marine Headquarters after Morgan's escape.

reveals.information: Holds the rank of Vice Admiral in the Marines
Has an unconventional, casual personality despite his high rank, even falling asleep during official business
Takes an interest in training promising young Marines

keyMoments.title: Bogard's Debut
keyMoments.description: Bogard appears for the first time as Garp's right-hand man, a tall Marine officer in a beige suit carrying a katana.
keyMoments.significance: Introduction of Garp's mysterious and loyal subordinate who will appear sporadically throughout the series.

relationships.description: Bogard serves as Garp's right-hand man and trusted subordinate.

evolutionMoments.description: Bogard appears alongside Garp, established as his loyal aide.

reveals.information: Tall Marine officer who wears a beige suit and hat, carries a katana

keyMoments.title: Luffy Remembers Koby
keyMoments.description: Luffy remembers Koby when Morgan's name is mentioned, showing their enduring friendship despite being on different paths.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates that Luffy values his friendship with Koby and thinks about him, setting up the parallel storylines.

keyMoments.title: Working as Marine Chore Boy
keyMoments.description: Koby is shown working alongside Helmeppo as a chore boy, cleaning swords and cannonballs, doing menial Marine tasks.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Koby's humble beginnings in the Marines and his dedication to his dream despite starting at the bottom.

keyMoments.title: Taken Hostage by Morgan
keyMoments.description: Morgan takes Koby hostage during his escape attempt, threatening his life.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Koby's bravery in the face of danger and his growth since first meeting Luffy.

keyMoments.title: Recruited by Garp
keyMoments.description: Garp recruits Koby to train at Marine Headquarters, recognizing his potential.
keyMoments.significance: Major turning point in Koby's Marine career, setting him on the path to becoming a strong Marine under legendary training.

relationships.description: Koby becomes Garp's student when recruited to train at Marine Headquarters.

evolutionMoments.description: Garp recruits Koby for training at Marine Headquarters.

relationships.description: Koby supports Helmeppo through his emotional crisis about his father.

evolutionMoments.description: Koby listens to Helmeppo's feelings about his father, strengthening their friendship.

reveals.information: Works as a chore boy doing menial tasks in the Marines
Selected by Vice Admiral Garp for special training at Marine Headquarters

keyMoments.title: Working as Marine Chore Boy
keyMoments.description: Helmeppo works alongside Koby as a chore boy, cleaning swords and cannonballs, a stark contrast to his privileged life in Episode 2.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Helmeppo's complete transformation from spoiled brat to hard-working Marine recruit.

keyMoments.title: Helmeppo's Conflicted Feelings
keyMoments.description: Helmeppo reveals his complex emotions about his father - respecting and wanting to be like him, but knowing he went too far. He cries wondering if Morgan will be executed.
keyMoments.significance: Humanizes both Helmeppo and Morgan, showing Helmeppo's emotional depth and growth beyond his earlier antagonistic role.
keyMoments.quote: I respected my father. I wanted to be like him, but he went too far, abusing his position.

keyMoments.title: Taken Hostage by Father
keyMoments.description: Morgan takes Helmeppo hostage, declaring he doesn't need a son and just wants freedom.
keyMoments.significance: Morgan's ultimate rejection of Helmeppo forces the son to finally break free from his father's influence.

keyMoments.title: Helmeppo Disowns Morgan
keyMoments.description: After being thrown aside by Morgan, Helmeppo declares that he will let Morgan escape today but will capture him when they meet again.
keyMoments.significance: Helmeppo's defining character moment where he completely breaks from his father and commits to his own path as a Marine. Completes his transformation arc.
keyMoments.quote: I'll let you escape today, but someday, we will cross paths again and I will surely capture you on that day!

keyMoments.title: Recruited by Garp
keyMoments.description: Garp recruits Helmeppo to train at Marine Headquarters alongside Koby.
keyMoments.significance: Sets Helmeppo on his new path as a Marine under legendary training, cementing his redemption arc.

relationships.description: Helmeppo disowns his father Morgan and vows to capture him, transforming their relationship from father-son to adversaries.

evolutionMoments.description: Morgan rejects Helmeppo and Helmeppo vows to capture his father, severing their family bond.

relationships.description: Helmeppo becomes Garp's student when recruited to train at Marine Headquarters.

evolutionMoments.description: Garp recruits Helmeppo for training at Marine Headquarters.

relationships.description: Helmeppo confides in Koby about his feelings regarding his father.

evolutionMoments.description: Helmeppo opens up to Koby about his conflicted feelings toward Morgan.

reveals.information: Despite everything, Helmeppo respected his father and wanted to be like him, but recognizes Morgan went too far
Helmeppo has fully transformed from spoiled brat to dedicated Marine, working hard at menial tasks
Helmeppo severs ties with his father and vows to capture him as a Marine
Selected by Vice Admiral Garp for special training at Marine Headquarters

keyMoments.title: Morgan Being Transported
keyMoments.description: Morgan is shown in chains being transported to Vice Admiral Garp for his court trial after being defeated by Luffy.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the consequences of Morgan's defeat and sets up his escape.

keyMoments.title: Morgan's Escape
keyMoments.description: Morgan slashes Garp, breaks his chains, and begins fighting through the Marines to escape.
keyMoments.significance: Morgan's escape demonstrates he remains a dangerous fighter even in defeat.

keyMoments.title: Morgan Rejects His Son
keyMoments.description: Morgan takes Helmeppo hostage, declaring he doesn't need a son and only wants freedom.
keyMoments.significance: Morgan's ultimate act of cruelty toward his son, choosing freedom over family and forcing Helmeppo's final break from him.
keyMoments.quote: I don't need a son. I just want freedom!

relationships.description: Morgan rejects Helmeppo as his son and uses him as a hostage, severing their family bond.

evolutionMoments.description: Morgan declares he doesn't need a son and takes Helmeppo hostage during his escape.

reveals.information: Being transported for court trial after his defeat
Escapes from Marine custody during transfer to Garp
Values his freedom over his son, completely rejecting Helmeppo
